p: Polyphenols, especially flavonoids, are considered important molecules for the human diet and, consequently, are often proposed as ingredients in food supplements and nutraceuticals. In fact, in addition to being antioxidant agents, they are endowed with several other biological activities [ 38]. For instance, flavonoids were proven active as anti-inflammatory [ 39], anticancer [ 40, 41], antihypertensive [ 42], microcirculation improving [ 43], and hypolipidemic agents [ 44]. They proved also interesting as active ingredients in the cosmetic field [ 45, 46, 47] and as natural dyes [ 48].
